Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 31st overall pick, by Minnesota in 1965...
Injured on 6/15/1965 with a Sore Back, out for one week...
Injured on 7/13/1965 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 7/19/1967 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 7 weeks...
Earned first career win on 6/1/1969...
Injured on 7/7/1971 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 6/8/1972 with a Hyper Extended Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1977...
Injured on 9/20/1978 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1978...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Won Cy Young Award in 1981, going 19-7, 2.16 ERA...
Injured on 7/14/1982 with a Strained Bicep Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1982...
Drafted in 2nd round, 36th overall pick, by Texas in 1985...
Traded from Texas to Chicago (N) on 5/12/1985 (Going to CHC: LF P. Incaviglia. Going to TEX: 1B J. Rice)...
Injured on 4/14/1986 with a Torn Bicep Muscle, out for full season...
Injured on 5/19/1988 with a Bruised Neck, out for 3 days...
